column11: Notes
Higher agrochemical & water inputs; big regional variance.
Blue-water scarcity risk high; chemical load.
Lower blue-water use; still fertilizer/pesticides.
Reduced synthetic chemistry; lower GHG vs conventional.
Avoids irrigation in many regions; very strong profile.
Organic agronomy + social standards.
Practice improvements; not organic; chemistry still present.
Lower inputs than conventional; not fully organic yet.
Soil health, reduced inputs; program/region-specific.
Longevity benefits; irrigation common.
Avoids farming; fiber shortening; often blended.
Closed‑loop dissolving pulp from textile waste.
Often rain‑fed, low inputs; durable & biodegradable.
Low pesticide/water; high durability.
Bast fiber; chemical retting possibilities.
Low-input bast fiber; biodegradable.
Bast fiber similar to jute; low inputs reported.
Experimental apparel fiber; low-input potential.
Agri-residue fiber; processing chemistry varies.
Lignocellulosic; apparel limited; trims/insoles.
Enteric methane & land use; long lifetime offsets possible.
Improved grazing/animal welfare & traceability.
Avoids farming impacts; strong circularity.
High land pressure; low yield per animal.
Animal welfare & land concerns.
Impacts vary by region; lower methane than cattle.
Resource & ethical issues; not top-tier impact.
Deforestation & chemistry risks without safeguards.
Improved pulp sourcing & recovery.
Marketed green but depends on viscose process chemistry.
Lyocell route improves chemistry & recovery.
Lower-impact MMCF; biodegradable in conditions.
Similar to viscose but improved with certifications.
Chemistry & effluent critical; varies by facility.
Acetylation solvents; EoL concerns.
High energy; microplastic shedding; dominant fiber volume.
Lower energy/CO₂ vs virgin; shedding persists; downcycling risk.
Towards circularity; depends on chemistry & energy mix.
High energy; N₂O concerns from adipic acid; shedding.
Waste diversion; improved vs virgin; shedding persists.
High energy; poor recyclability; microplastics.
Small % in garments but hampers recycling.
Petrochemical; EoL issues; fewer toxins than PVC.
Potentially better recyclability than PU; still petro-based.
Chlorine chemistry & additives; EoL/toxicity concerns.
Fossil reduction in feedstock; similar EoL & shedding.
Lower fossil input; performance nylon; still microplastics.
Compostability limited to industrial conditions; brittleness issues.
Bio-synthesized; promising EoL; early apparel adoption.
Binder polymers vary; mixed early LCAs.
Binder drives impact; durability a factor.
Agri-waste feedstock; polymer binder influences impact.
Upcycled feedstock; binder & longevity matter.
By-product allocation; welfare concerns.

Combines pros/cons; recycling difficult due to separation.
Lower fossil demand; still hard to recycle.
Strong circularity benefits; quality management key.
Durability vs recyclability tradeoff.

Dye chemistry & water load; depends on process.
